page.title: 11Local History,Kinross Area
page.content: {The Weaving Industry}has been one of the main factors in Kinross' industrial history for a century.The Kinross linen works opened in 1873 and was taken over in 1963 by Todd & Duncan.Nowadays the factory spins high quality cashmere and lambswool for garments which are exported world wide.Current price for a cashmere sweater is Â£170.These are popular with American tourists. {Curling}has been practised in Kinross since 1688 on Loch Leven in winter but now is played on the indoor rinks of the Green Hotel.{Kinross Museum}, situated above the library in the High Street,has a small but varied display, ranging from a penny-farthing bicycle to prehistoric flints and arrow heads.
